name: places/ChIJtclkPfTzwokRLKcgf6JyzYA
formattedAddress: 512 W 212th St, New York, NY 10034, USA
adrFormatAddress: 512 W 212th St, New York, NY 10034, USA

originalText.text:
100 years ago I went to school here. Reviewing a school is tough, should I mention they gave homework? Should I deduct a star for the homework? Some of the teachers were really smart and funny so I will add a star. But lunch sucked so I will deduct a star. But the cafeteria was fun so I will add a star.

Recess was great so I will add a star, but no long enough so deduct 1/2 a star. The principal was like the CEO but I never saw the dude and he had a big office but I was little so maybe it wasn't that big?

Assembly was ok because that meant not in class so add a star but the actual assembly was boring so deduct a star. The walk to school was long deduct a star but my legs were short so maybe I shouldn't deduct a full star.

The building was old deduct 100 stars. No central air deduct 100 stars, but suffering builds character and stamina so maybe add 1 star. No elevators deduct 75 stars, but it was good exercise so add 1 star.

The P.E. teacher was really serious about P.E. deduct 1 trillion stars, I was very bendy and flexible as a child so add 1 star.

They had an awesome art enrichment program when I attended add 1 infinite number of stars, they took away that awesome art enrichment program and replaced it with teaching to the test, deduct 1 infinite number of stars.

So in conclusion, if you are a kid maybe go here or maybe don't go here. If you are a parent visit or maybe home school or maybe drop your child off with the squirrels in the park. I dunno.

originalText.text: I went here from pre-k to kindergarten. In/around 2008. And my best friend that i met last year went here too, this is a very good school.

originalText.text:
Graduated 5th gade in this school. Loved it. Went through ups and downs but it's the best elementary school ever. Really recommend it.
#5thgradeGruaduate2012
